member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.DifferentialAssemblyTextFileConfigurationBinder
member.summary:
An implementation of configuration binder that persists configurations into an embedded text file. The binder will have a unique identifier to differentiate different context on the same schema.
Imagine if we have three different development stages i.e. Development (DEV), Testing (TS), and Production (PROD), and we have a database configuration that may use different address between development states buat with the same configuration schema.
Using this class, we can have three file named (for example) DB-DEV.config, DB-TS.config, and DB-PROD.config with the same configuration schema inside but with different database address configured. Then, we can use appropriate file by defining the marker of this binder passed into the constructor.

member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.BaseTextFileConfigurationBinder
member.summary: A partial implementation of configuration binder that persists configurations into text file.

member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationBinder
member.summary:
Default implementation of a configuration binder.
Configuration Cabinet stores one or more Configuration Binder. Think it like an office drawer cabinet which stores paper binders. Configuration Binder is like a paper binder which group one or more Configuration Item (which, in this analogy, is a paper).

member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.IConfigurationBinder

Configuration Cabinet stores one or more Configuration Binder. Think it like an office drawer cabinet which stores paper binders. Configuration Binder is like a paper binder which group one or more Configuration Item (which, in this analogy, is a paper).

member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder
member.summary:
An implementation of configuration binder specification that bridge two configurations with Master-Slave style organization. The Master Binder acts as the primary binder and backed-up by the Slave Binder. If one or more configuration requested don't exist in the Master Binder, then the Slave Binder will be consulted.
NOTE: THIS CLASS IS STILL IN ALPHA STAGE

member.name: M:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs instance of this class

member.name: M:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder.AddConfiguration(Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationItem)
member.summary: . If the mode is Master then the passed configuration will be added to master configuration, vice versa.

member.name: M:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder.GetConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: . Master binder will be consulted first, if nothing found then the Slave will be consulted.

member.name: M:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder.GetConfigurations
member.summary: . The returned results will be the combination from the Master and the Slave.

member.summary: Master Configuration Binder

member.summary: Slave Configuration Binder

member.name: P:Toyota.Common.Configuration.ConfigurationMasterSlaveBinder.Mode
member.summary: Binder's mode. This determines what binder to be prioritized, the master or the slave. Particularly used by AddConfiguration, .

member.name: T:Toyota.Common.Configuration.VolatileConfigurationBinder
member.summary: An implementation of configuration binder specification that does not persists any of its configuration into persistence media. In formal understanding, it means the data will be kept in the memory as long as the application need it.
